pageContext.description: Cutting edge entirely missing; the end-section shows the metal 45mm thick, the sides being separated by a gap of which is filled up with wood. Faces of blade have three facets; prominent mould marks along sides. Large loop.
pageContext.associations: Part of a large hoard; see card for first socketed celt.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Journ. XXX, 279,Evans,Jessup, Arch of Kent, 107,Journ. Anthrop. Inst., 230
pageContext.site: England,Kent,Saltwood,Hayne Wood, on limit of railway cutting, 6 ft. below surface, lying on stratum of sand, c. 25 yards NE by N of summit of hill.,Found June 4, 1872
pageContext.toSearch: Saltwood, Hythe, Hythe, Kent Ct21, UK
